item.title: I criticized Amazon's policies in a blog – their lawyers have subpoenaed me
item.description: - Amazon's policies prevent sellers from offering lower prices off-Amazon, which leads to higher prices for consumers.

item.title: Federal judge: Border searches of cell phones require a warrant
item.description: - A district court judge in New York has ruled that a warrant is required for a cell phone search at the border, "absent exigent circumstances".

item.title: JMAP – a modern email open standard
item.description: - JMAP is a new email standard that is open to innovators and developers, and was recently published by Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).

item.title: Rust has been forked to the Crab Language
item.description: - Crab Programming Language is a new programming language with its compiler, standard library, and documentation.

item.title: I gave commit rights to someone I didn't know (2016)
item.description: - Trusting OSS contributors can have positive effects, even more than expected, as it makes them take their contributions more seriously.

item.title: Show HN: I open sourced the QR designer from my failed startup
item.description: - The QR Designer is a web app that allows users to create QR codes with custom designs in the middle section.

item.title: Ask HN: Where have you found community outside of work?
item.description: - The post is a discussion thread on Hacker News, where people are sharing how they found community outside of work, primarily in the tech industry.

item.title: Plane: Open-Source Alternative to Jira
item.description: - Plane is an open-source project planning tool for managing issues, sprints, and product roadmaps.

item.title: How to Stare at Your Phone Without Losing Your Soul
item.description: - The amount of time spent staring at your phone doesn't matter as much as whether your phone is a needy, attention-sucking vampire.
